00.text: When life's storms rage, rest assured that God is your refuge, a fortress shielding you with His steadfast love, bringing calm and peace to your soul.

01.text: Therefore, since we have been justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ.

02.text: Through him we have also obtained access by faith into this grace in which we stand, and we rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

03.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

04.text: Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

05.text: Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

06.text: Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God so that at the proper time he may exalt you...

07.text: Casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.

08.text: But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

09.text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.

10.text: For if while we were enemies we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, now that we are reconciled, shall we be saved by his life.

11.text: But let all who take refuge in you rejoice let them ever sing for joy, and spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may exult in you.

12.text: For you bless the righteous, O Lord you cover him with favor as with a shield.

13.text: I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life.

14.text: And this is the confidence that we have toward him, that if we ask anything according to his will he hears us.

15.text: And the prayer of faith will save the one who is sick, and the Lord will raise him up. And if he has committed sins, he will be forgiven.

17.text: Therefore do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

18.text: For he wounds, but he binds up he shatters, but his hands heal.

19.text: He will deliver you from six troubles in seven no evil shall touch you.

20.text: Now the law came in to increase the trespass, but where sin increased, grace abounded all the more...

21.text: But test everything hold fast what is good.

22.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness...

23.text: Which is easier, to say, Your sins are forgiven you, or to say, Rise and walk?

24.text: He who calls you is faithful he will surely do it.

25.text: If we live by the Spirit, let us also keep in step with the Spirit.

26.text: And amazement seized them all, and they glorified God and were filled with awe, saying, We have seen extraordinary things today.

27.text: After this he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax booth. And he said to him, Follow me.

28.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

29.text: But Peter and the apostles answered, We must obey God rather than men.

30.text: I can do nothing on my own. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is just, because I seek not my own will but the will of him who sent me.

31.text: God exalted him at his right hand as Leader and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.

32.text: I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.

33.text: You shall walk in all the way that the Lord your God has commanded you, that you may live, and that it may go well with you, and that you may live long in the land that you shall possess.

34.text: And he said to her, Daughter, your faith has made you well go in peace, and be healed of your disease.

35.text: He was a burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.

36.text: But overhearing what they said, Jesus said to the ruler of the synagogue, Do not fear, only believe.

37.text: Let what you say be simply Yes or No anything more than this comes from evil.

38.text: They came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and Jesus saw a commotion, people weeping and wailing loudly.

39.text: But I say to you, Do not resist the one who is evil. But if anyone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

40.text: And if anyone would sue you and take your tunic, let him have your cloak as well.

41.text: And if anyone forces you to go one mile, go with him two miles.

42.text: Give to the one who begs from you, and do not refuse the one who would borrow from you.

43.text: I have come in my Father''s name, and you do not receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

44.text: But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you...

45.text: So that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.

46.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?

47.text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe my words?

48.text: You therefore must be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

49.text: When uncertainty clouds your path, trust in God's wisdom, which is a guiding light, steering you toward hope and abundant blessings.

50.text: In times of doubt, remember that God's love is unwavering, a gentle whisper assuring you of His presence and guiding you toward a future filled with hope.

51.text: In moments of weariness, lean on God's strength, for He renews your spirit like an eagle soaring high, filling your days with renewed hope and joy.

52.text: When the road is tough, remember that God walks beside you, offering His peace and strength as you journey toward His promises.

53.text: In the midst of life's challenges, hold fast to God's promises, for His faithfulness is unchanging, providing you with unfailing hope and enduring strength.

54.text: When life's storms rage, anchor your heart in God's peace, for His presence is a sanctuary, calming your soul and igniting hope within.

55.text: When worries cloud your mind, trust in God's wisdom. He lights your path like a steady lamp, guiding you through the darkness with hope and clarity.

56.text: In the quiet moments, remember God's gentle whisper of love, assuring you that He holds your future and fills your heart with peace and purpose.

57.text: When you feel weary, draw near to God, for He renews your spirit with His boundless love, giving you the courage to face each day with hope and joy.

58.text: In every trial, lean on God's strength, for He is your unwavering rock, lifting you up with grace and filling your heart with steadfast peace.

59.text: Even in the valley of uncertainty, God's promises are a guiding light, leading you with love and filling your heart with courage and joy.
